info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 31 at 9:21PM CDT until April 04 at 7:32PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Illinois... Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, The Dively and Vandalia Levees begin to be overtopped. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 23.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM CDT Thursday was 23.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.3 feet on 02/16/1949. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue Kaskaskia River Vandalia 18.0 23.2 Thu 9 pm 26.3 22.9 17.0 14.6 13.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
